content.question: Let <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, the natural log of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. Which of the following gives the volume of the solid generated when the region <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi times, the integral from, 0 to 1, of, open parenthesis, e to the y power, minus 1, close parenthesis, d y" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times, the integral from, 0 to 1, of, open parenthesis, e raised to the 2 y power, minus 1, close parenthesis, d y" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times, the integral from, 0 to 1, of, open parenthesis, e to the y power, minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, d y" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times, the integral from, 0 to 1, of, open parenthesis, e to the y power, plus 1, close parenthesis, squared, d y" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="pi times, the integral from, 0 to 1, of, open parenthesis, e to the y power, minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, d y" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 8.10: Volume with Disc Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
